sect1.title: Preconfiguration File Example
sect1.para: This is a complete working example of a preconfiguration file for an automated install. Its use is explained in . You may want to uncomment some of the lines before using the file.

note.para: In order to be able to properly present this example in the manual, we've had to split some lines. This is indicated by the use of the line-continuation-character \ and extra indentation in the next line. In a real preconfiguration file, these split lines have to be joined into one single line. If you do not, preconfiguration will fail with unpredictable results.
A clean example file is available from &urlset-example-preseed;.
